mmud.rest.services

Class GameBean

  • java.lang.Object
    • mmud.rest.services.GameBean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RoomsInterface

    @Path(value="/game")
public class GameBean
extends java.lang.Object
implements RoomsInterface
    Takes care of all the game-related functions.

      • authenticateWithPassword

        protected User authenticateWithPassword(java.lang.String name,
                            java.lang.String password)

        This method should be called to verify that the target of a certain action is a user with the appropriate password.

        Parameters:
        password - real password
        name - the name to identify the person
        Returns:
        the authenticated User
        Throws:
        javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - BAD_REQUEST if an unexpected exception crops up or provided info is really not proper. UNAUTHORIZED if session passwords do not match or user not found.

      • isBanned

        public boolean isBanned(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String address)

        Checks to see if a person is banned from playing.

        Parameters:
        name - the name of the person
        address - the ip address the person is playing from
        Returns:
        true if banned, false otherwise.

      • create

        @POST
@Path(value="{name}")
@Produces(value={"application/xml","application/json"})
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response create(@Context
                                                  javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest requestContext,
                                                  @PathParam(value="name")
                                                  java.lang.String name,
                                                  PrivatePerson pperson)

        Creates a new character, suitable for playing.

        Parameters:
        requestContext - for headers, like remote address.
        name - the name of the user
        pperson - the data of the new character
        Returns:
        NO_CONTENT if the game is offline for maintenance.
        Throws:
        javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - BAD_REQUEST if an unexpected exception crops up or something could not be validated.

      • delete

        @DELETE
@Path(value="{name}")
@Produces(value={"application/xml","application/json"})
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response delete(@PathParam(value="name")
                                                    java.lang.String name,
                                                    @QueryParam(value="password")
                                                    java.lang.String password,
                                                    @QueryParam(value="password2")
                                                    java.lang.String password2)
        Deletes a character, permanently. Use with extreme caution.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the user
        password - the password of the character to be deleted
        password2 - verification of the password, a second time.
        Returns:
        Response.ok
        Throws:
        javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - BAD_REQUEST if an unexpected exception crops up.

      • logon

        @POST
@Path(value="{name}/logon")
@Produces(value={"application/xml","application/json"})
public java.lang.String logon(@Context
                                        javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest requestContext,
                                        @PathParam(value="name")
                                        java.lang.String name,
                                        @QueryParam(value="password")
                                        java.lang.String password)
        Logs a character in, to start playing.
        Parameters:
        requestContext -
        password - password for verification of the user.
        name - the name of the user
        Returns:
        the session password upon success
        Throws:
        javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - BAD_REQUEST if an unexpected exception crops up.

      • play

        @POST
@Path(value="{name}/play")
@Produces(value={"application/xml","application/json"})
public PrivateDisplay play(@PathParam(value="name")
                                     java.lang.String name,
                                     @QueryParam(value="lok")
                                     java.lang.String lok,
                                     @QueryParam(value="offset")
                                     java.lang.Integer offset,
                                     java.lang.String command,
                                     @QueryParam(value="log")
                                     boolean log)
                    throws MudException
        Main function for executing a command in the game.
        Parameters:
        lok - the hash to use for verification of the user, is the lok setting in the cookie when logged onto the game.
        name - the name of the user
        command - the command issued
        offset - the offset used for the log
        log - indicates with true or false, whether or not we are interested in the log.
        Returns:
        NO_CONTENT if the game is offline for maintenance.
        Throws:
        javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - BAD_REQUEST if an unexpected exception crops up or something could not be validated.
        MudException

      • retrieveLog

        @GET
@Path(value="{name}/log")
@Produces(value={"application/xml","application/json"})
public PrivateLog retrieveLog(@PathParam(value="name")
                                       java.lang.String name,
                                       @QueryParam(value="lok")
                                       java.lang.String lok,
                                       @QueryParam(value="offset")
                                       java.lang.Integer offset)
        Retrieves the log of a player.
        Parameters:
        lok - the hash to use for verification of the user, is the lok setting in the cookie when logged onto the game.
        name - the name of the user
        offset - the offset from whence to read the log
        Returns:
        returns the log
        Throws:
        javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - BAD_REQUEST if an unexpected exception crops up.
        See Also:
        PrivateLog

      • deleteLog

        @DELETE
@Path(value="{name}/log")
@Produces(value={"application/xml","application/json"})
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteLog(@PathParam(value="name")
                                                       java.lang.String name,
                                                       @QueryParam(value="lok")
                                                       java.lang.String lok)
        Removes the log of a player, i.e. creates a new empty log.
        Parameters:
        lok - the hash to use for verification of the user, is the lok setting in the cookie when logged onto the game.
        name - the name of the user
        Returns:
        Response.ok if everything's okay
        Throws:
        javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - BAD_REQUEST if an unexpected exception crops up.

      • quit

        @GET
@Path(value="{name}/quit")
@Produces(value={"application/xml","application/json"})
public javax.ws.rs.core.Response quit(@PathParam(value="name")
                                               java.lang.String name,
                                               @QueryParam(value="lok")
                                               java.lang.String lok)
        Stops a playing character from playing.
        Parameters:
        lok - the hash to use for verification of the user, is the lok setting in the cookie when logged onto the game.
        name - the name of the user
        Returns:
        An Ok response.
        Throws:
        javax.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - BAD_REQUEST if an unexpected exception crops up.

        Description copied from interface: RoomsInterface
        Returns the room with this specific id. Returns null if no room is found.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        id - the id of the room
        Returns:
        the room or null, if not found.
